website_summaries.verdict: Reliable brewer with a nice design that can fit most cup sizes. Comes equipped with a variety of convenient features.
pros: Basic and easy to use option that brews coffee quickly
Good sized water reservoir is easy to refill
Can fit larger mugs with the drip tray removed
Coffee comes out hot and the machine runs quieter than some other brewers
cons: Does not fit large thermoses (16 ounces or more) and is not programmable

customer_reviews.title: Grounds in your coffee
customer_reviews.text: Real disappointed in my Mixpresso Single serve coffee maker. I tried about 6 pods and every time there were coffee grounds everywhere. And they were genuine, name brand pods. In the instructions for trouble shooting, there was not even any mention of an issue with coffee grounds nor on their website. Also, whoever wrote the instruction manual doesn't understand english as there were mispelled words, incorrect phrases and other issues that make no sense. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: nons

customer_reviews.title: Still no answer on the tiny replacement part needed to make it work!
customer_reviews.text: I still need the little plastic ring that holds a k cup in the slot, Without it all you get is hot water because the k cup is not high enough to puncture. If you puncture it yourself makes a mess and coffee does not turn out well!@ I would have given it 5 stars but now we cannot use it. The manufacturer did answer that they would not replace the machine but that is not what I asked for! Help// anyone else have this problem?
customer_reviews.author: sma krueger

customer_reviews.title: Bye-bye Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: After a bad love affair with 3 Keurigs during the past two years, I finally found my true love..Mixpresso! It's not fancy, doesn't have all the bells and whistles of other coffee brewers, but it works! It takes any pod (even ones I had left over that Keurig wouldn't take), and it brews a great cup of coffee. That's all I ever wanted. Water reservoir is smaller, but makes 3 large cups before re-filling. Beep-beep tells me my coffee is done! And..it actually brews coffee that doesn't taste like colored water! I'm in love.
customer_reviews.author: Sisters

customer_reviews.title: 1 star because of customer support
customer_reviews.text: An OK machine until you need a part. The rubber gasket around the puncture needle wore out and when I contacted customer support for this 69 cent item they basically told me to get bent. I have had similar problems with other purchases and always received parts in a timely manner. on occasion for free. need less to say I trashed the Mixpresso Single Serve K-Cup Coffee Maker and will never purchase from them again. They want you to buy a whole new machine not a very inexpensive part.
customer_reviews.author: david crockett

customer_reviews.title: Great price but mechanics for actually brewing a cup are a bit confusing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after going through 3 Keurigs that I was forced to return. I gave Mixpresso a try because of its reviews. The size is great for counter space and I love the color- BUT the water heats a bit slow and the mechanics of actually brewing a cup are confusing--it is not clear when it is ready and for the first week - I actually thought it was malfunctioning- It does have an automatic shut off which is nice for safety- but it turns after 15 min.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Fast Coffee, Nice looking, fits in a smaller space
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using this coffeemaker for a few weeks, but so far, its been great. It holds enough water for several cups and is easy to use. I haven't had to clean it yet, but for those reading, with my old coffeemakers and my dishwasher, the best thing I have found to clean them with is powdered Citric Acid. With a coffeemaker run a TB or two through the coffee cycle and then run several cycles through with just water to get it all rinsed out, works like a charm. With a dishwasher, fill the detergent cup with citric acid through a heavy cycle, it will clean out the scale buildup in your dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: JoniBean

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than a Keurig, cheaper than a Keurig, quieter than a Keurig, and the coffee is hotter. If it lasts more than 3 years, it will have outlasted my Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: grandmaGigi

customer_reviews.title: WOW!! So glad I bought this one... Fast, Hot, Easy Quiet
customer_reviews.text: My Keurig 2.0 Platinum died just after 3 year warranty expired. Decided to buy another Keurig until I read the many negative reviews about the quality decline. Spent several weeks combing through the many units offered on Amazon, many of which also had some bad reviews, and decided to take a chance on this one. SO GLAD I DID. I have been using it daily for 2 weeks and it is WONDERFUL. Easy to fill, much faster and hotter than Keurig (30 sec) and has a lighted area that shows when the rear fill tank needs filling. Three cup sizes that can be programmed. Will follow up after I've had it awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Pat by the Sea

customer_reviews.title: Nice minimalist design at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm very impressed by this machine. It is surprisingly small for its capabilities. The design is clean and functional with a minimalist style. The water container is rear-mounted and lifts vertically so access could be an issue in under-cabinet locations. Happily, the water level indicator(a floating red button) is located on the front-left of the unit. The lighting of the unit is soft and quite elegant at night. The water dispensing sound is a low, light, growl..........different but not objectionable. Overall, a very nice product, very fairly priced and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Potentially a Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have had my machine for a week. The packaging is first rate and the product seems to be of high quality. It works very well...but it turns off to quickly for my second cup so I am trying to extend the standby time. I hope this works. If it does and the machine works for a decent amount of time then it gets a full 5 stars. By the way, to insure longevity just buy the 4 year warranty for $9.95. It is still great even with that added.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Brawn

customer_reviews.title: not durable
customer_reviews.text: largely worked okay, but started spazzing out on the amount of coffee it would make per kcup. Sometimes it reminded me of an old tv as you would slap the side and it would work fine again. Finally petered out after a mere 16 months, so I decided this belated review was in order.
customer_reviews.author: RMS

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Have been a coffee pot user for up ton years. Problem with a coffee pot is after a short time, the coffee starts to get a burnt taste. Coffee goes to waste. Finally decided to get rid of the ol' coffee maker/pot and get one of these. WOW. Works well. It takes up no more space than a regular coffee maker. Makes a nice cup of fresh coffee every time. Didn't want to spend a lot of money and surely did not want some expensive, fancy unit. Mixpresso was a grand slam. Very happy and can say, get one, you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: carole

customer_reviews.title: Brews a great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the coffee machine it did not put out the amount of water I expected and I was getting ready to return it but I tried it again the next day and it worked great. It is so easy to fill the reservoir and I located it near the sink and use the sprayer hose to fill when needed so I do not even need to remove the tank. I like the way it opens and closes for the k cups. It is a very sturdy machine and brews a good cup each time. It works great and is less than the big name k cup machines
customer_reviews.author: alvinleejohnson

customer_reviews.title: First one the coffee coming out of the spout was divided and spraying a bit outside of cup (wide mouth cup) but was good and hot - filter without paper top
customer_reviews.text: Only received 2 days ago and have made 3 cups of coffee all using my own coffee and a reusable cup with 2 different filters. First one the coffee coming out of the spout was divided and spraying a bit outside of cup (wide mouth cup) but was good and hot - filter without paper top. Second, used filter with the paper top - coffee good and hot - all coffee stayed inside the cup. There was alot of coffee sludge in the bottom of the cup however, may have been the grind of the coffee was not right. Anyway, jury is still out. Returned 2 Keurig Minis and replaced with this one. I hope it works.
customer_reviews.author: Christi Hinton

customer_reviews.title: It worked great, looked great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine last summer. It worked great, looked great, and made great coffee. I liked it so well I bought one for our vacation home. Three weeks ago the first machine stopped working. I emailed Mixpresso to see what can be done, is it covered under warranty? Their website said they would be in contact within 24 hours, I am still waiting for a response. Even the finest equipment breaks down, but fine equipment should have great customer service. Customer service should be easy to contact, and when contact is made they should be ready to remedy the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Mixpresso is great!
customer_reviews.text: I received the machine 4 days ago and have been using it for 3. Happily, I am very pleased with the ease of use, how quiet it is, the size and that it makes a great cup of coffee. If it continues to function as it does now for another 2 to 3 years, I will be ecstatic. The only con for me is that the water level gauge located on the front isn’t lit bright enough for me. I have eye problems so the blue light is very dim and I have to turn the machine to see how much water is left. Otherwise, I love the Mixpresso.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy B

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item 2 weeks ago and worked wonderfully! Last week it stopped brewing full cups. I ordered a replacement which arrived yesterday, 9/1/2020. I set it up this morning and it does not brew at all!!!! I did the troubleshooting. It heats up fine, but does not brew. Both are going back this morning and I am getting a full refund. I am very disappointed as this product is made in Italy. I thought that was a safe bet and it had good reviews. I had a very difficult time choosing a coffee maker after having a keurig for many years. What a debacle!
customer_reviews.author: Annette Curri

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little machine. It's a big step up from the Keurig Vue I was suckered into buying by Keurig (which has now been discontinued). I don't know what other reviewers are talking about when they mention the loudness of the machine; it's just a low level hum. It heats up super quick and hot. I've just had it a short time, so I can't speak as to its durability. Hopefully it will keep making me happy for a long time. There's nothing better than a great cup of hot, steamy coffee first thing in the morning!
customer_reviews.author: Wlg/tn

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this machine for 617 days. On average, it made a cup 4 times a day. So, it's made 2,468 cups total, so far. The machine has worked absolutely flawlessly for each cup. The taste is as good as expensive Keurig machines that I've owned. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it, it fails after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This product worked until it started failing to make 12 Oz coffee cups that I had it set for after 6 months of use. It would make about 5 Oz max. So I did the recommended de-scaling, but same result. Their warranty is 12 months, and I tried to contact them. They responded but didn’t provide any solutions or recommendations. So the product and warranty are worthless. I don’t recommend buying this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this machine, but.....
customer_reviews.text: It works as it should, but I wish the coffee was hotter. I end up putting it into the microwave for a minute after brewing to get it right... Not a major issue. I have also placed hot water into the tank to get a better result. I do use alot of milk, though. That being said, I have friends who spent a little more $ on another brand maker, and the coffee is much hotter than with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ronrizz

customer_reviews.title: Customer Support Pending
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and was happy enough with it that I bought a second one for my son. Three months later, my son dropped and broke the water reservoir. I am not blaming the design for the fact that it broke. My problem is that I have contacted the manufacturer twice using their "Contact Us" link and they have not responded for several weeks. UPDATE: 3 emails went unanswered, but they answered the phone the 2nd or 3rd time that I called them.They emailed me a form to fill out. I will update this when the transaction has completed. UPDATE : I received the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer Mike

customer_reviews.title: Mixpresso coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: After about a month, I must rave about this coffee maker. It makes coffee much faster than the other machines we have owned, and my husband says it makes a better cup of coffee. It also allows for 3 different amounts which is great. The water container is easy to remove to clean... we don't remove it each time we refill, but rather just add from the cup. If this machine will just last longer than the others (Mr. Coffee and some other off brand), we will buy again and again. I expect it to as it seems much sturdier and better built. And it really doesn't take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: outdoor cook

customer_reviews.title: poor alternative to the "K" named brewer
customer_reviews.text: I had it for a week and sent it back today. I brewed side by side cups of the same coffee (same box) with this brewer and my old "K" brewer. This brewer makes much more bitter coffee. The temperature when brewed is much lower too. I added milk to the coffee from the Mixpresso as I always do with my coffee. I had to put the coffee in the microwave to warm it up, never had to do that with my "K" brewer.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Mixpresso for well over 6 months. It works amazingly well. The buttons produce the same amount of coffee each time. The coffee has good strength relative to other K-Cup compatible coffee makers I've used. The reservoir produces about 3.5 cups of the largest cup of coffee. I wish it would produce 4-5, but that's a small issue.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: First one GOOD, Second one BAD
customer_reviews.text: Loved the first one I bought, no issues, smaller than Keurig. Bought second one for office and after making 1 cup, about 10 minutes later it started "beeping". Had to unplug it. Called the support number and as instructed, left a message. Never got a call back. Returned the unit using Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Terry K. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee and looks good too.
customer_reviews.text: We had been thinking about a K-cup machine for years, but were always put off by the hideously ugly Keurig-brand machines. This is the first K-cup machine that we've seen that actually doesn't look like a Cylon. Works great - makes excellent coffee (Newman's Own French Roast). Convenient as a hot-water dispenser for making tea as well. The tank is nicely designed and easy to refill - holds 3 to 4 mugs worth of water. Sure, it's a bit noisy during the brew cycle, but not really that bad, and it only takes a minute or so.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Steve

customer_reviews.title: So far great!
customer_reviews.text: After suffering through the ownership of several Keurigs, I had to find a different coffee maker. The reviews of the new Cuisinarts were not good. Thought I might give this Mixpresso a try and tho it’s only been a week, it has been wonderful. It’s a simple machine. Just makes the coffee in three cup sizes. Doesn’t clog. I even dug out some light roast kcups that I was not able to use in the Keurig because they clogged EVERY time and they now work in this new machine. It does have a smaller water reservoir but I can live with that. The price is also reasonable and it takes up a bit less space. Hopefully it will last.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopper44

customer_reviews.title: Low Profile and Takes Up Little Counter Space
customer_reviews.text: We love our new coffee maker. This is much better than the Keurig we had which gave out a little after a year. I love the low profile design and that it doesn’t take up much space on the counter. It holds 40 ounces of water.
customer_reviews.author: Katrice

customer_reviews.title: Better than Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd Mixpresso machine. We owned 3 Keurigs prior to these. We got fed up with the chemical smell that the Keurig water reservoir has (Keurig just kept telling us to clean it with vinegar which never worked) and decided to try something new. The Mixpresso heats up faster and can produce a larger ounce cup of coffee with their alternate settings. The only thing it could improve is to have a larger water reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I have not owned any brand of k cup brewer before, so I researched many models and offerings before deciding this Mixpresso was best for me. I have not been disappointed at all. The coffee brews quickly and is really hot like I like it. I love the removable water "tank" that is easy to fill with my refrigerator's filtered water dispenser. The entire unit fits under the upper cabinets on my kitchen counter, without it being necessary to move it out in order to operate the press handle. I'm loving the quality and everything about this Mixpresso!
customer_reviews.author: Cork

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - this machine leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. This coffee machine leaks. A few weeks after the return date, this coffee maker started leaking all over the counter. I messaged the manufacturer asking for a refund or replacement with NO RESPONSE. I bought if for my elderly mother that lives in the upper peninsula of Michigan; she has limited stores around her. This was very much a disappointment and WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: kr

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2.5 years of every day use!  Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Halfway through it’s life it started sputtering water from its spout causing coffee droplets to fall to the sides of the mug. This eventually would cause stains. I was able to clear the problem by de-scaling. After about 2.5 years it no longer pumps water into the kcups. What a POS. At least my previous “keurig” branded machine lasted twice as long. However, this machine definitely made you a cup of coffee faster than any keurig machine I’ve owned. And it’s cleaner. But it won’t last you as long.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you!!!
customer_reviews.text: You might think that cheap means poor longevity....not with this unit. 31/2 years later this unit is still going strong, as of now it lasts twice as long as a $200 Touch or Keurig. Was tired of the short lifetime of these units and opted to buy a cheaper unit and treat it as a throw away unit, well it surprised me. We are brewing on average 6 cups a day on the unit. Well done Mixpresso!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Fought myself getting this because of the k-cup trash but I LOVE this thing. Pop in a cup and can get 3 or 4 LARGE cups of coffee before having to fill up the reservoir. It looks nice and sleek on the counter and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product; I have been very pleased with my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product; I have been very pleased with my purchase. My only complaint is that the water reservoir is in the back of the product and there's no light to indicate that the water is low. Several times, I haven't noticed that water needed to be added and ran the machine. I don't think any permanent damage was done, but it does make a terrible sound and there's a bit of a burning smell. A Keurig won't let you run the machine when the water is low. Other than that, I've been really happy with it. It's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: Great single serve coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I have used this coffee maker for a few weeks now and I love it. It works great and holds enough water so that I don't have to fill it every time, but it is small enough so that the coffee maker isn't huge on my counter. There is a one-year warranty on this coffee maker. Mine made it 14 months and then stopped working correctly. I liked the product enough that I ordered another one. Let's hope it last's longer this time! Update - the new coffee maker was not working properly. I contacted the company and they authorized a return, and sent me a replacement. This one woks perfectly. So, THANK YOU very much!!
customer_reviews.author: F. E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Love the compact size
customer_reviews.text: Received our Mixpresso Single Cup Coffee Maker today. Love the compact size; we live in a condo with limited counter space. We also love the simplicity of this brewer; less to go wrong & easy to use. I ran a cup of water through it after washing the reservoir. Then, I made the first cup of coffee! It was wonderful; full-bodied, hot, quick. We were replacing a high-end Keurig with all the bells/whistles that started malfunctioning after 6 months. I have high hopes for this Mixpresso.
customer_reviews.author: L. K. Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you will like it
customer_reviews.text: Single cup Coffee Maker but has 45 oz reserve so it actually can make 10 "cups" just like the big boys without re-filling it up. It is smaller and sturdier to the feel than the 100 dollar Keurig pot. It does not handle the large diameter cups, the ones that look like small cereal bowls with a handle and it does not have an auto turn on feature. Very fast to warm up: Put in K-cup Close brewing handle down completely to seat K-cup, then push on. It takes 25 seconds to heat up, then select cup size to brew.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: I was able do dial in a good brew using a custom grind and refillable cups
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday. I was able do dial in a good brew using a custom grind and refillable cups, BUT the coffee was not not, just warm. I tested the brewing temp and fond it to not be about 135, not adequate for brewing coffee. Even with a preheated heavy ceramic cup, it was early hot enough. Maybe I have a defective machine. It's going back. I'll call them.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: Good hot coffee from a convenient and easy to use maker.
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee from this single cup coffee maker. Fast start up and the convenience of making several cups without refilling the reservoir is nice. Coffee is very hot when brewed. We are using refillable k-cup cartridges and they work perfectly. Easy to take apart to clean - run the parts through the dishwasher. Works directly with shirt mugs but not our tallest thermal cups. Did get Amazon extended warranty as there isn't any history of longevity and our old Bunn MyCafe only lasted a little less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: J. Howell

customer_reviews.title: 3 Months Was It...
customer_reviews.text: The first 3 months it worked fine and fit nicely in my kitchen with it's compact design. It was about then I noticed an increased noise level when brewing. Then the following day it produced half of a normally full cup. I had previously run a descaling process as per instructions in the user guide 2 weeks before this. I ran another cleaning to no avail. The noise level increased and partial cups were the result. It's now part of a recycle process.
customer_reviews.author: cager

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Due to changing work schedules in our house now we needed to move away from a regular coffee maker to a single serve model. After reading the reviews (and experience with the Kuriegs we have at work) I decided to give the Mixpresso a try. Have had it for a week, use reusable k-cup compatible cups. Works great. Takes a little over a minute from pressing power button to start heater to finished cup. Coffee is hot, water reservoir is easy to fill, overall very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Appleton

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Our first K-cup machine, so can't compare to anything else, but so far this unit has been great. It's very easy to use and is versatile. For the price I don't think it can be beat. Have only been using it a month, so can't comment on durability, but it appears to be very well built. Just press the "on" button, wait about 30 sec to heat up, then press the cup size button. Couldn't be any easier. A cup of coffee in about a minute. Also great for tea - just don't put in a coffee pod.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L. Wien

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging produced a product that failed to perform.
customer_reviews.text: I was not given the option to love or hate it. It arrived, poorly packed in a box three times its size with some random paper crushed up and thrown in the box. Naturally I was not surprised that after carefully following the operating instructions the machine failed to even produce a stream of hot water. When I ordered the machine I was enticed by its attractive design but good looks didn't result in even one cup of coffee. It was returned today.
customer_reviews.author: Sultan Peppa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This brewer is a continuation of a former brand name which used over 4 years now. MixPresso now owns the brand. It is super reliable unless you run it dry (accidentally) which I did and had to buy a new one. I recommend this brewer over the "other" one so well known. I had two of the other brand brewers and neither lasted a year. You can trust the MixPresso brewer if you take care of it. The best one out there.
customer_reviews.author: Brac

customer_reviews.title: Great price, look, and size.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas. He really likes it (and he's picky) he said it heats up fast and the coffee is hot, hotter then his, much older, Keurig. The price was better and it looks sharp. The fact that it takes up less space on his counter is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best K-cup brewer I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Have had Keurig & Cuisinart K-cup coffee makers. Cuisinart was the better brand for me, but had to eventually replace it. Wanted a small footprint like my old Cuisinart with a decent water reservoir & finally found this one. It's great in every way, especially the taste of the coffee & the temperature it brews. Have only had it 6 weeks, but am very pleased thus far. Best K-cup brewer I've ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy V.

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: I really wish the reviews were more recent. Many are from 2026/17 when the coffee maker was manufactured differently. I had my old machine for 3+ years before it broke. The new 2020 machine does not hold my old basket due to new shape on pod holder. It’s no longer open, except small hole for coffee. The pod holder I had didn’t fit and it’s very hard to clean now. Mixpresso coffee pods made sludge in this maker so I don’t know if it’s the pods or machine and now don’t want to invest in more pods. DONT FIX SOMETHING THAT WASNT BROKE - the older style was much better.
customer_reviews.author: MJF

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Small, Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Just got our coffeemaker last night and tried it this morning. We're impressed with the small footprint and design. It's very easy to clean and use. Much quieter than our last coffeemaker; it just makes a vibrating hum. We like that it does a clean center punch on the bottoms of the disposable KCups. Our refillable KCup fits perfectly. Going through the "get acquainted" stage of figuring out which button/button combos fill what size mug. Hoping it doesn't clog as easily as other coffeemakers we had but, since we've never seen a single serve coffeemaker that doesn't get finicky, we took the extended warranty just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Pat J

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Like some other reviews, my Mixpresso quit working properly after about two weeks. Excessive water streaming out of the bypass tube just behind where the coffee comes out. Mixpresso asked for a short video showing the problem, and after I sent it they promptly replaced the unit. Clearly there is a valve seal or control issue causing this. I would hope Mixpresso would research and fix the problem but with so many already on the shelves it might take a while for the better model to get to us. The Corona Virus isn't helping much either.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE : After nearly two years of heavy use it performs well. It is just a little slow. Once I was told you have to close the lid I see that it does not take long to heat the water. I have had this for a week or so. It does its job----after about a 20-minute wait for it to heat up in the morning. I was willing to give up the programmable features that my old Kurig has, but this thing exudes cheapness in the materials, so I'm doubtful it will last long.I guess it is a good thing I kept that old Kurig as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Gonkulator

customer_reviews.title: Really works with both K cups and reusable filters!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Keurig coffee maker as a gift and doing that research discovered this Mixpresso that will deliver the convenience of using K cups as well as loose and bag teas and coffees! Reading the directions and following was an easy task and had no problems in set up. When our electricity went out for a few minutes, we forgot it needed to be reset the next morning, but after we remembered, back to work with no hitch! My husband loves using it everyday instead of stopping to buy coffee! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Wise Owl

customer_reviews.title: Please tell me I got a defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to program. Very slow. Water kept dripping well after cup removed making it dangerous. I am thinking I got a defective one and returning. It looks good and is compact for more counter space. Hopefully my unit was defective. I am assuming so. If not I clearly would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: It works.... Misleading promo code in box
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice affordable unit. I’m only on day 2, but works as expected. I’m a little disappointed that included in the package was a promo code for $8 off from Amazon for a box of KCups. The code doesn’t work no matter the size and brand of coffee I choose. Very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lindblad

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to use and seems to be sturdier
customer_reviews.text: It is almost identical the Keurig machine but only half the price. It is very easy to use and seems to be sturdier. It accepts refillable cartridges and virtually any kind of cartridges. It has a smaller footprint. I love it. The only problem is, it seems to give a weaker coffee when refillable cartridges are used, but I will experiment to see what can be done about this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Math Twain HY

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work when I received it. would not recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: After only 1 week this thing has stopped working. Selecting the 10 oz. option and using 2 k-cups gives me just barely 12 0z. of coffee. I am disabled and it is impossible for me to return this item so I will just chalk this up to lessons learned. It is going in the trash as soon as I can get a replacement with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Mixpresso!
customer_reviews.text: After my Keurig Elite quit pumping the water, even after descaling (even though the only water that was used was softened and RO filtered) I decided to look for an alternative coffee maker. When I read all the positive reviews about the Mixpresso, I decided to give it a try. It does not have all the bells and whistles that the Keurig elite had, but I decided I didn't need the clock and the programing for the auto turn on because the Mixpresso literally heats up in seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Janice B.

customer_reviews.title: the flavor is a lot better!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just started to use it Coffee taste is delicious So far so good This purchase is to replace a series of Keurig coffee pod machines that always quit working after we descale them. Hope this lasts longer than the “other” brand! AND the flavor is a lot better!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Better than that "K" machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine heats in under a minute, makes a 12 oz. cup in just about a minute that's coffee shop hot & doesn't sound like it will wake the dead in the process. I love that it has a 45 oz. water reservoir on it too. You can program the sizes of the cups... 6, 8 & 10 or 8, 10 & 12 oz. and set the amount of time before it powers off. What great features! I love this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2017. I much prefer it to some more famous brands I have used. It works well, makes great coffee, takes up less counter space. I have used various brands of coffee pods as well as refillable pods. It is also very durable. I knocked it off the counter a year ago and it fell onto a hardwood floor. The only damage was it popped one of the tabs holding the side panel on. I popped that back in and it has continued to work perfectly since then. If this one ever dies, I will replace it with the same thing. It's proven to be a great purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer cojo49

customer_reviews.title: Very Simplistic!
customer_reviews.text: This simple coffee maker is just what I was looking for! The reviews seemed positive and were right. All you do is hit the power button with the K-Cup compartment closed, wait 30 seconds or so for the lights to stop flashing (preheating), insert the K-Cup and close, select the size and about a half minute later, your coffee is ready. The temp showed 170 with my cheap infared temp gun and the coffee tastes good. I leave the K-Cup compartment open and remove and rinse the Pod holder after each use with the power off.
customer_reviews.author: solara8

customer_reviews.title: The beverage temperature isn't hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: My only disappointment with this unit is the temperature of beverage. I like hot beverages (12 oz. setting) to be hot enough that I have to blow on the top of the cup and take small sips initially. That way, it is still a warm beverage while drinking the last half of the mug. I always microwave it for 30 seconds as soon as it completes brewing in this machine.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for the same model I purchased over a year ago. I have come to the conclusion, despite routine cleaning and de-scaling, that all brands (and I have had many) last about a year with my usage pattern (8-12 cycles per day for coffee, tea or hot water). I reordered this brand because it heats up quicker and cycles faster than others in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Boborino

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit as a replacement for the first one I bought. My old Mixpresso is over two years old but still works fine. The older unit started leaking a little but not bad enough to replace yet. I really like this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ropeman

customer_reviews.title: All of my guests who drink coffee rave about the coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: I love the color, it's easy to use, it doesn't leak, it allows me to make water for tea, and I like that I can make a small, medium, or large cup. Since I only drink one small cup each day and add milk to it, I put the used pod in the fridge and use it a second day.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, needs instruction booklet
customer_reviews.text: HI, I really like the coffee maker, it's great. I kind of muddled through because I couldn't find the instruction booklet. Luckily I've made coffee a few times before. I like it, I'd just like to know more about it. I'm bump this up to 5 stars right away if I had the instruction booklet. Actually I did decide to bump it to 5 stars, I just emailed the company and will be asking them to send me an instruction booklet, they seem to be very customer centric.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Girl

customer_reviews.title: You best bet for single serve and simple!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not by the Keurig single serve ... buy this. This is a well built and well designed machine that I am putting in my office. It is small and just has the best design. You can fill the reservoir easily and it works great. I have the Keurig which is just a mess. If you overfill it, it leaks (as an overflow 'feather's) onto the counter and is simply a poor design. I am so happy.with this (bought 2)
customer_reviews.author: Officer999

customer_reviews.title: Finally a consistent cup with ease
customer_reviews.text: Quietly brews a good cup of coffee. We have been using for 2 and a half years now. Would buy again if this one ever dies.Yes, you do have to check the water level yourself, but in my book that's just one less thing to break down.
customer_reviews.author: John Haluszczak

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival, water did not leave the reservoir. So disappointing.Sent it back the day I received it. Also, I left a a message with mixpresso customer service and they never returned my call.....
customer_reviews.author: Lori Seligmann

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Heats fast, makes coffee like my keurig (maybe faster) looks nice
customer_reviews.author: Mary Catherine Wurth

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, seems to be well made
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work well at all. Two K-cups, one a Green Mountain, one a Gevalia, two cups of coffee full of grounds. Nice unit, seems to be well made, easy to use, not sure why its spitting out the grounds but it sure wasted my money...
customer_reviews.author: BlackJack

customer_reviews.title: Money saver!!
customer_reviews.text: As of today I have had this machine for about 2 years. I use it up to 3 times a day, it works very well and love that it accepts re-usable cups unlike Keurig. Will definitely buy another if it ever breaks down.
customer_reviews.author: DMEN

customer_reviews.title: Water Reservoir Leaks
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is nicely built, is a compact size, and has a few nice features. It does heat up quickly, and we liked being able to change the cup sizes. The reason for the low score is that the water reservoir continuously leaks all over the counter. We will be returning the coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well constructed appliance. Makes coffee at the proper speed to bring out the best coffee flavor. The coffee is made at a higher temperature than the Kurig it replaced and is likely reason there is more flavor. This seller sent emails to ask if everything was okay and to make sure I was happy. It's nice to see sellers more concerned with your satisfaction instead of just making money. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The machine looks nice, the brewing time is fast
customer_reviews.text: The machine looks nice, the brewing time is fast. However, it splatters during the brewing process and rattles a bit. The coffee was hot but not too hot. I’ve used other machines where the coffee was steaming and I didn’t have to heat it up after adding milk. The bottom line is I was really looking forward to keeping this machine and have to say I was disappointed. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: coffee cup stand area is too small for bigger mugs so holding the cup is necessary
customer_reviews.text: very nice and convenient coffee maker but one thing that i would not buy another one like this is that the cup stand space is so small that you can either fit only small cups there or will have to hold the bigger cup whole time while the coffee is being dripped otherwise nice coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than our Keurig  You can brew any brand pod or K cup you want!
customer_reviews.text: Great coffeemaker. Had Kerrigan that died way too early and did not allow me to brew the brands of coffee and pods I wanted. This did the trick. Our daughter just asked for one for herself for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Gal

customer_reviews.title: At Last!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is superior to my failed Keurig machines in many ways - It's footprint on the counter is much smaller. Its easier to refill the reservoir. It is more solid and far better engineered. It is easily programmable to adjust amount of water. It is easy to program how long it remains on. It brews at 192 degrees, not the tepid 170 that came out of my old machine.
customer_reviews.author: KAL

customer_reviews.title: Wake up to a good cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I’m sitting enjoying my cup of coffee right now I had a small part of Mr. coffee and with one person I was wasting too much this fits nicely in the corner quickly brews a good cup of coffee and there’s no mess to clean up
customer_reviews.author: Linda P. Adams

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffee maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker!! I've had a few in the past and this one is perfect. It's a slim profile (both in height and width) so doesn't take up as much space on my countertop. I love the water tank in the back but water level view is in the front. I love the fact I can change the default of the ounces of coffee the machine makes to accommodate larger coffee mugs or travel mugs. I can't say enough good things about it!!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Great design, bad grinds
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and the footprint, I hate grinds in my coffee. I tried different K-cups in this machine all with the same results, almost all of the grinds from the K-cup end up in my cup. One of the K-cups, exploded all over the top of the the machine. I really liked the design the water reservoir, the light indicating water level, all great. I'm sorry this machine is a failure. I must return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker really delivers the flavor.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is so much better than the Keurig machine we had. The actual flavor is much fuller. I am using the same coffee pods I used with previous machine and the brewing process on the Mixpresso makes a much more robust cup. I am very pleased. Size is perfect and the coffee comes out very hot. I did actually read the instructions and you can change the cup brewing sizes to suit your needs, and the the auto off function as well. I really am impressed. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: ksue

customer_reviews.title: single cup brewer Mixpresso
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for several months, so dependability is unknown. It makes good hot coffee in 3 sizes and has a larger water reservoir than my last one which was a Mr. Coffee Keurig single cup. It takes a couple of minutes to heat up before you can select your cup size, but that is if you keep it unplugged as I do. When left plugged in, it heats quickly. I have not tried the coffee brand offered by Mixpresso. I just use whatever I pick up at the grocery store.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Yates

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: We had the original Keurig for over 2 years when the pump went out. We purchased the Keurig K2 from Keurig using rewards points. It did not work correctly from the beginning: slow, touchscreen went blank or changed screens intermittently, etc. We put up with this even call Keurig customer service with no results. While searching for another single cup coffee maker, I discovered the Mixpresso and after reading all of the positive reviews purchased it. We have had it for several weeks and we love it. It is simple with no touchscreen thank goodness. Uses K cups. We are very satisfied. Just hope it holds up for a few years. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Cup measure not consistant
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a month or so, now the measurment is not consistant. I ask for the middle cup every time and i may get half cup.
customer_reviews.author: William Booker

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: It’s only been a couple of months but it works great. Some reviews say it’s too hot or it damaged the pots. Well it makes very hot water which makes better coffee. All you have to do is use quality pots and follow the directions. It makes the best coffee then others I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker, coffee is hot and it makes your coffee in seconds once water is initially heated, water stays hot for an hour. Perfect for my office at work.
customer_reviews.author: T Logan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great little coffee maker!! Its the perfect, compact, size, for the corner of our counter. Super easy to use and to refill. Works very well! Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Barbra Losi

customer_reviews.title: Good design but serious quality issues
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a unit that my wife and I wore out. The prior unit lasted a little over 2 years so we were satisfied enough to buy another. We plugged in the new unit and it would not function at all - it appeared to be a defective motor. We returned it for a replacement. The replacement does not dispense the correct amount, but at least the motor operates. Sorry, nice design but the quality is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie W.

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Keurig
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker does not brew the coffee hot enough. I have to microwave my coffee after brewing to get it to my liking. The reviews were so great I decided to try and wish I would have returned. Going back to Keurig on the next one.
customer_reviews.author: kathrynwithaK

customer_reviews.title: Love my machine
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this kcup coffee machine. I was going to go with a keurig but after all the reviews I decided to go with this one and let me tell you it was worth it. Its super easy to use, heats up quickly, and coffee always comes out nice and hot. Would definetly repurchase again.
customer_reviews.author: JohnJay

customer_reviews.title: May or may not work when you get it
customer_reviews.text: Coffeemaker would not make right amount of coffee. Tried programming it several times. But no luck. Ask for the coffeemaker to be replaced. Got a new one. So far it is working great. But will wait a few days and make sure it works. Now I have to return the bad pot which can be a hassle. First one should have worked. Where is the quality control. Apparently China doesn’t have quality control. 7/18/20 the 2nd Mixpresso is working great. Just wish the first one had worked. Returning products that do not work takes time out of our daily schedule. Customers should be able to enjoy products when they are first ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Spring

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: When I started shopping for a new coffeemaker last year, I read that the new Keurigs only allowed you to use specific types of coffee pod -- so I said "bah!" to that and took the leap of faith and bought this unknown (to me) brand. It was so much cheaper that I wondered if I was being foolish...well, that was almost 18 months ago and it hasn't given us a day of trouble. This coffee maker works well with all the coffee pods I've tried, is simple and quiet and low profile, and it makes a nice cup of coffee -- excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Ion

customer_reviews.title: Grounds in coffee
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the machine and ease of use. The machine turns itself off so has to be turned on before using. It seems to warm up better when kcup holder is closed. Coffee is a good strength and tastes good. Major problem is huge amount of grounds in coffee cup. I plan to try a different brand of coffee to see if that improves the situation.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stop settling with the Keurig
customer_reviews.text: Update...it's now July...STILL love this coffee maker! If you remove the stand for the coffee cup you can fit a standard insulated container in the space. I just bought this single cup coffee maker. So far it is FANTASTIC! I thought it was easy to set the automatic turn off and cup sizes. The reservoir is easy to fill and reseat. Coffee is definitely better with the hotter water!!!!! I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought 2.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, gets water very hot in short order. Liked it so much bought another one for my office. It does pull a lot current (hence the fast hot water), It pulls so much in fact it has to pulse the current so it won't pop a breaker, sometimes the overhead lights will blink as the water heats. I will gladly put up with blinking lights for fast hot water. Good job Mixpresso!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after few months, no response from supplier
customer_reviews.text: Started out great and within 3 months the selection button quit working, so it would only make the small cup. Not useful for an office. It says on the box one year warranty but I’ve tried thru Amazon to get Mixpresso customer service to respond. That was weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee make, best price!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for 1 week now and I am in love with it. It looks great and performs great as well. I love how easy it is to fill up with water and it has a water indicator in the front, even though the water reservoir is clear with making in the back. It heats up water very fast. The only negative thing I could think of is that when you first turn it on you have to wait like 20 seconds for water to heat up before you could choose your cup size (hit start).
customer_reviews.author: PHILLYGUY
